website_summaries.verdict: City commuters who want an authentic "ride the train, bike to work" experience will want to consider the Speck. At only 22 pounds, this folding bike is easy to carry, and the single fixed gear is uncomplicated.
pros: Aluminum frame is lightweight, easy to transport
cons: Professional adjustments may be necessary out of the box
Only includes back pedal brakes, front brake is optional
Single speed gear ratio is low

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Returned bike after we gave up on assembly. Repacked carefully since box arrived with large hole, used lots of duck tape. We were very upset, I really wanted a folding bike. My husband and I spent several hours trying to get this so called preassembled folding bike put together. The book that arrived in the box had no directions for this bike. Plus, there was a extra very long screw in the box with no place to go. The opening and closing of the folding bike is difficult to understand and we never mastered it. So frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Happy

customer_reviews.title: Only good / safe for flat 1-3 mile rides
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bike for people 5 ft 8” or shorter. I am just over 6ft and cannot comfortably ride this even with the searpost maxes out. Not meant for climbing or descending hills. Had to change the saddle and add a front brake to improve the ride quality and safety. I would not buy this bike again unless priced below seventy bucks. Bottom line: it’s okay for 1-3 mike short and flat rides. Otherwise, uncomfortable and unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Mihai

customer_reviews.title: Everywhere I ride, people love this bike.h
customer_reviews.text: Stem collar needs excessive tightening, needs larger screw in stem slide. Done, no big deal. Spoke with distributor, very helpful. Odds are, you can pay more and still not find perfection. DO NOT extend stem or seatpost beyond limiter. Dangerous. No bike fits everyone. A 23 lb. head turning folder for 300 bucks? I can handle the adjustments. Gonna' buy another for winter backup on my delivery routes.
customer_reviews.author: waltackerman

customer_reviews.title: Good bike, bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: The bike itself works great. My issue is with the way it was packaged. The box on arrival had holes in the sides around the wheel axis. Shipping was also a day late. The paint on the bike was significantly damaged due to it rubbing against itself where it folds, despite the padding. The damage greatly ruined the paint, but for me it is not enough to go through the hassle of returning the bike for a new one. Like I said, the bike works fine, and required minimal setup (installing the pedals and tightening the seat). The instructions that came with the bike were for an entirely different bike. Don't confuse people by sending it with these directions.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Budhram

customer_reviews.title: Folds nicely and the single speed design is simple and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike to use in racing paddocks to get around without having to drive everywhere, or walk. Folds nicely and the single speed design is simple and durable. My only complain is the seat post is not high enough. I normally ride a 59-60 cm frame in a road bike and this is probably 55 cm at best. I am not riding more than 5-8 miles a weekend, so I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: George H

customer_reviews.title: Hip looking, okay for what it is, but not as well made as the company's website would have you believe.
customer_reviews.text: light weight, medium workmanship... the company info leads you to believe you are receiving a precision instrument, but it is of mid level components. Careful attaching the pedals. Despite its light weight the "fixie" bike is slow. It does catch people's eyes, and is great for my short treks to campus. It's benefit is lightness, and that it can fold to a small size. The seat is comfortable, but rips easily. fortunately it is value priced for what it is, though my Giant Half that was stolen was a better bike, even if it weight significantly more.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Franz

customer_reviews.title: I like it! an excellent bike for the money I paid
customer_reviews.text: It is almost assembled when it arrives. Just need to tight the bolts and assemble the pads. Read the manual of the part about how to install the pads before you start your job. The front light is optional. The bike is light and easy to fold and unfold. The only drawback is that you need to adjust the angle of seat if you fold the seat. They should use the same design as the front handles.
customer_reviews.author: leafbrooks

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike!
customer_reviews.text: I just unpacked it and tried it out. I love this little bike. The chain was too tight and caused some resistance when cranking. I loosened the wheel and backed it off slightly which eased things up. Other than that it, was just a matter of unfolding it and off I went.I thought the smaller wheels and sorter cranks would take some getting used to but it was very comfortable from the get-go. We'll see how it holds up. Looks and feels very sturdy. I see no reason to believe with normal use and care, it won't last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality and a lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy Bike for a foldable even though it is lightweight. I weigh around 175 pounds and it feels like it could carry a lot more. Fast to fold and unfold. Convenient for short distances of up to 2.5 miles - especially if you also plan on taking the train where you can board with it without needing much space. Great function, fun to ride. Mine came with a scratch which is the only reason I won't give this bike five stars. I still kept it as it is so much fun to ride and will possibly get scratches in the future anyways as I intend to use it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Myself At Amazon

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.text: Sweet-looking, lightweight folding bike. I use it to scoot around NYC and it reminds me of my childhood BMX days in the best ways possible.

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Best bike I have ever owned. The safest bike for those bad with breaks.. Coaster break, great build, quick fold.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Nice Looking, Lightweight, Folding Exercise Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking "exercise" bike. If you want a good work out bike whose main advantage is that it folds into the trunk of your car, then this is worth considering. If you want a comfortable saddle, a fast bike, a bike that climb hills easy then you need to look elsewhere. The bike is shipped almost completely assembled. You just need some allen wenches you can buy at Wal-Mart to tighten everything. Is one of the lightest folding bikes. With no cables & gears it is virtually maintenance free. Is going to be a keeper for me.

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous and serious safety hazard!

product_meta.title: Retrospec Bicycles Speck Folding Single-Speed Bicycle
product_meta.description: Retrospec Bicycles has been a leading manufacturer of urban and commuter bicycles since 2008. While we have successfully launched bicycles of all kinds, our "less is more" mentality always leads us back to a simple single-speed drive train and ultra-light aluminum frame. The Retrospec Speck is a foldable single-speed that operates on a coaster brake which allows you to stop easily by pedaling backward. No brake cables or shifters are necessary so this bike is simple and easy to maintain, ride, carry and put away in a small space. Ergonomic grips and the famous Retrospec saddle make this a luxurious bike that will make each ride comfortable. The Speck is recommended for riders ranging from 4'8 to 6'6, under 240 lbs.
feature_bullets: Folding single-speed bike with rear coaster brake perfect for riding around the city, easy to carry and store in small spaces
Ideal for commuting or exercise on paths that are mostly flat or smaller hills
Lightweight Aluminum frame is up to 30% lighter than steel or chromoly
20" Wheels with Kenda Kwest commuter tires with smooth rounded tread with large water dispersion grooves
Folding time of 10 seconds with folding handlebar tube, top-tube and pedals
